entry.title: World's (not yet so) finest
entry.summary:
Author: Jayden_Jones (KoaKillianAZ)

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,207Chapters: 1/50Kudos: 0

Summary: To put it in simple words, Jim Gordon is a pain in the ass. The Gotham police department needs to get rid of him as soon as possible, fortunately, corruption exists everywhere, so once he and Harvey Bullock are sent to "help" the police department of a small town called "Smallville", Gotham is ready to Burn. Unexpectedly, Alfred Pennyworth and Bruce Wayne accompany him to the little town. Bruce swears he'll leave as soon as possible, until he meets a gallant young boy, Clark Kent, and suddenly, they can't leave each other's side

entry.title: The Oblivious Lives of Observant Men
entry.summary:
Author: 3HobbitsInATrenchcoat

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,269Chapters: 18/25Kudos: 351

Summary: Clark Kent meets Matches Malone while working on a story, and the pair hit it off almost immediately. Meanwhile, Superman is getting established as a hero, and slowly becoming friends with Batman. Bruce just wants to figure out if he can maintain three separate identities, raise a kid, and keep his reporter boyfriend somewhat in the dark. It's a three-way double-blind secret identity scramble.

entry.title: The cold boy that met the sun
entry.summary:
Author: Arachnophobic_SpiderMan

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,084Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 21

Summary: What happens when Alfred Pennyworth finds 15 years old Bruce Wayne's suicide plans ? What happens when Bruce Wayne runs away ? What happens when he finds himself in Smallville, Kansas, on the anniversary of his parent's murder ? He meets Clark Kent, that's what happens.orI need more of fics where Bruce and Clark meet as teenagers, and even more fics in which we get to see how broken a kid like Bruce Wayne can be after a traumatic experience. Honestly i wrote this for myself, if someone likes it I'm glad! Tags may be add as the story goes fyi. Also english is very much not my first language and it shows, so no hate pls okayy? thanksss xx

entry.title: Whatever happened to imaginary friends?
entry.summary:
Author: CoffeeTrees

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 98,339Chapters: 20/20Kudos: 1,590

Summary: Tim, the ever vigilant (always awake and never giving himself a break) vigilante, gets word of a drug bust going down. One he just so happens to be the only one available to stop. Which happens to be taking place in the very early hours of his birthday. Of course he goes on the highly dangerous bust alone. What could happen?   Or: Tim is used to being the Robin that gets thing handled, that doesn't need Batman to come rescue him. Bruce Wayne had made it very clear in the early days that Tim was not his son. Alfred Pennyworth was cold, allowing only the politeness and distance to show through his Iron Wall. Dick Grayson treated him the way he wished he'd treated his brother, Jason. Tim was fine with this. He wasn't a child. Even if he wished for more of the small slivers of love the Wayne family were just starting to give him, he wouldn't dare take Jason Todd's place. He just hoped the support he provided for the grieving family would make Jason proud. But Jason Todd came back, and he sure made it known he wasn't. He made sure Tim knew exactly what he thought of the cuckoo in his family. Now, the Wayne family has their lost son back and Tim has a job to do. Just, not in this dimension?

entry.title: The Agony And The Ecstasy
entry.summary:
Author: Burntbowlofrice

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,124Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 57

Summary: Forewarning: I don't know much of canon, it's been a while, and the first chapter is heavy for information and setting instead of development. The Marvel universe is grateful for her heroes saving her the first time, but the trauma she's gathered is too much for her to continue on for much longer. With the last of her power, she detaches some of her heroes from her own self to save them before the collapse of everything they've ever known. Now in Gotham, Tony and Peter salvage together a life, ready to take down enemies and play by this new world's rules for now. But the further into this world they get, the more accepting they are to their situation, and the more friends they find and make along the way. If anyone has any suggestions of what I need to correct, canon, grammar, or punctuation wise, feel free to comment.

entry.title: the soul selects her own society
entry.summary:
Author: familiarfantasy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 479Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 26

Summary: "Bruce Wayne? Gotham’s golden prince, her favorite son. The tabloids joked that everyone knew everything about Wayne, which was usually far too much. He wasn’t simply an open book, rather having the pages highlighted and annotated for anyone to peruse. The man’s favorite artist was Britney Spears. He went on frequent skiing trips to Aspen. He had Calvin Klein ads that covered billboards and sex tapes leaked from his college days. Clark didn’t tend to follow celebrity scandals, but the man’s life, ever since he reentered the public eye, seems to have been made for spectacle...The first two days, Clark was completely and utterly convinced the universe had made a mistake. He wasn’t meant to have a soulmate in the first place, and there wasn’t a chance his words were connected to Wayne of all people. All he could do was mourn the soulmate he was supposed to have, the one he had expected, the person he was destined to save not as Superman, but as Clark Kent." or, how Clark Kent discovered his soulmate was Bruce Wayne, then took it upon himself to figure out who the man truly was.

entry.title: Between Masks
entry.summary:
Author: AceofWeb

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,863Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 14

Summary: Written by the request of Cheerfully_Melancholly , this chapter follows Dick as he finally finds a moment alone in Wayne Manor, free from missions and expectations. What begins as a simple act of self-indulgence turns into something far more intimate, a quiet rebellion against the constant performance of being perfect. Alone, he confronts his reflection, his desires, and the body that has never fully felt like his own. For a brief, stolen moment, he allows himself to feel whole, to imagine being truly seen. But just as he begins to surrender to that fragile illusion, the sound of a doorknob turning reminds him that even in solitude, he is never truly free

entry.title: You always said how you love dogs (I sit at the top of the driveway)
entry.summary:
Author: JanthonyTheWombat

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,650Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 25

Summary: Bernard has known pain his entire life. From the pain in his stomach when his parents sent him to bed without dinner, to the sharp pain of his mother’s perfectly manicured nails digging into his skin, to his father’s belt against his back, it had always been there. Perhaps, that was what drew him to the Children of Dionysus. Until… … … “Tim?” (Guys, don’t be put off, it’s like 80% fluff, it sounds a LOT worse than it actually is)
